p: The activation of natural killer (NK) cells also contributes to the immunity modulation by polysaccharides. Indeed, it has been shown that A. membranaceus polysaccharides can enhance the activity and killing effects of NK cells and promote their proliferation in rats with gastric cancer [ 110]. Moreover, they were able to increase CD3-CD4-CD8+ NKs in peripheral blood lymphocytes [ 111]. NKs activation is probably due to the polysaccharides interaction with the killer cell lectin-like receptor K1(KLRK1) of NKs [ 112]. Arabinoxylans extracted from wheat bran have been shown to inhibit the growth of transplantable tumors, and to promote the NK cell activity in S180 tumor-bearing mice [ 113]. Moreover, the MGN-3 rice bran arabinoxylan showed to enhance natural killer (NK) cell activity in aged C57BL/6 and C3H mice upon its intraperitoneal injection [ 114].
